alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 18 at 2:12PM MDT until August 20 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: Gusty southwest winds combined with relative humidity values around 13 percent will result in possible red flag conditions for the eastern plains including fire weather zones 241, 245, 246, 247, and 249 on Sunday between 2 PM and 8 PM. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 241, 245, 246, 247, AND 249. The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through Sunday evening. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 241, 245, 246, 247 and 249. * Timing...2 PM MDT to 8 PM MDT Sunday. * Winds...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 13 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid fire spread. Avoid outdoor burning and any activity that may produce a spark and start a wildfire.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
